NFL Redskins Mitchel to Miss Season Redskins Sixth round draft pick Tevin Mitchel is likely out for the season with a shoulder injury. Mitchel who played at Arkansas in college was hoping to earn a spot on the team entering training camp. After tearing the labrum in his left shoulder, Mitchel will miss the entire season and the team may end up reaching an injury settlement with him. by Jason Ferguson Photo Credit: Mr. J via Flickr

https://thasportsjunkies101.com/?p=94551

The Redskins are getting a boost at training camp from their newest, youngest coach. After six open-heart surgeries, 12-year-old Hunter Paulin is proving to be an inspiration to all down in Richmond. Jason Pugh reports on News4 at 5.

data.message:
What happens when you put NFL Hall of Famer Sonny Jurgensen, Emmy Award winning journalist Wendy Rieger and local media icon Andy O. in the same room? They help make our community a better place by taking the #WalkwithFrancis pledge. Follow in these legends footsteps (especially if you’re a  Washington Redskins fan!) and take on Sonny’s challenge for Redskins Nation 

www.WalkwithFrancis.org
Virginia Governor Terry McAuliffe takes in #SkinsCamp practice with #Redskins owner Dan Snyder & Richmond, Virginia Mayor Dwight C. Jones.
